title: Investing In Stocks: Discover The 3 'Big Rocks' For How To Buy Stocks

text:
When it comes to investing in stocks, it can be hard to know where to start. But to stay both protected and profitable in the stock market, it helps to focus on what we call the "three big rocks" of CAN SLIM investing. Following this approach will help you zero in on the top stocks to watch at any given time, names like Apple (AAPL), Amazon.com (AMZN), Nvidia (NVDA), and IBD Long-Term Leader Microsoft (MSFT).

X

As outlined in "How To Make Money In Stocks — Getting Started," the idea is to "put the big rocks in first." That is, to focus first and foremost on the key factors that most affect individual stocks and the general market. By putting these "big rocks" in before you could get potentially sidetracked by other factors, you'll be positioning yourself for long-term success investing in stocks.

You'll also be laying the groundwork for avoiding common investing mistakes that can hinder your results.

Following these three core principles is particulary important when navigating major market moments like the coronavirus stock market crash and eventual rebound.

Coronavirus Stock Market Surival Guide

Investing In Stocks: Big Rock No. 1

One of the most important tenets of investing for beginners and seasoned investors alike is this: Only buy stocks in a market uptrend. Take defensive action in a weakening stock market.

You can identify the current market trend by regularly checking Investor's Business Daily's Market Pulse, which shows which of three possible stages the stock market is currently in: Confirmed uptrend, Uptrend under pressure or Market in correction.

Over 100 years of stock market history show that three out of four stocks move in the same direction as the general market. You don't want to fight those odds! Instead, learn to stay in sync with the market and only make new buys when the odds are in your favor and the indexes are trending higher.

As Apple stock, Amazon stock, Microsoft stock, and virtually all leaders got hit in the current coronavirus sell-off, the importance of this one rule is clear. Stock market history shows how about three out of four stocks simply follow the overal trend of the major indexes. So it's not suprising to see most stocks get pulled down in the face of the coronavirus panic.

It's also not surprising that as the coronavirus stock market rally has taken hold, many of these leaders are now at or new new all-time highs.

Watch Free Webinar On How To Stay Profitable & Protected In Volatile Market

Investing In Stocks: Big Rock No. 2

Here's the second "big rock" of CAN SLIM investing that you want to keep in place: Focus on stocks with big earnings and sales growth driven by new, innovative products and services.

Stocks like Apple, Microsoft, Nvidia, Zoom Video Communications (ZM), and countless others become big winners as they post exceptional earnings per share and revenue gains. And these gains typically come from companies that are flashing something "new" — a new product, new management, or a new industry trend. This can also apply to stocks that have recently launched a new initial public offering, or IPO.

So when you're looking for stocks to buy and watch, keep a close eye on stocks showing these telltale CAN SLIM traits.

Investing In Stocks: Big Rock No. 3

The final key factor for successfully investing in stocks is to buy stocks being heavily bought by large, institutional investors and avoid those they're selling aggressively.

It's mutual funds, pension funds, banks, and other large money managers that account for the bulk of all trading in the market — not individual investors. Since these professional portfolio managers have the power to significantly move a stock up or down, it's crucial that you pay attention to what they are buying and selling.

For example, from February to April of this year, seven leading stocks received more than $1 billion each in investments from the top funds. This elite group included Apple, Facebook (FB), Microsoft, Netflix (NFLX) and Google parent Alphabet (GOOGL).

You can see what the best mutual funds are up to by using stock charts to track the price and volume action. With stock charts, you can get a truly objective look at the health of your stocks, without relying on rumors or hearsay.

See How To Invest In Stocks With This 3-Step Routine

Once you have a basic understanding of the three main factors that impact your stocks, put this approach into practice by making it a simple and streamlined three-step routine. By following these steps, you can quickly spot market trends, track stocks with the most important CAN SLIM traits, and see which stocks the best mutual funds are heavily buying (and selling).

The key is to follow the routine regularly so you stay in sync with the market, identify ideal buy points, and get a timely look at the best stocks to buy and sell. Market direction can change on a dime for better or worse, so it's crucial that you stay on top of any changes to the health of your stocks and the general market.

<li><a href="https://www.investors.com/category/how-to-invest/" rel="category tag">How To Invest</a></li></ul> <h1 class="header1">
Investing In Stocks: Discover The 3 'Big Rocks' For How To Buy Stocks	</h1>
<div class="featured-post-image-container"></div>
<div class="addtoany_share_save_container addtoany_content_top row">
<div class="share">
<div class="a2a_kit a2a_kit_size_25 addtoany_list" data-a2a-url="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investing-in-stocks-see-how-to-buy-stocks-investing-for-beginners/" data-a2a-title="Investing In Stocks: Discover The 3 'Big Rocks' For How To Buy Stocks"><a class="a2a_button_facebook" href="https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/facebook?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.investors.com%2Fhow-to-invest%2Finvesting-in-stocks-see-how-to-buy-stocks-investing-for-beginners%2F&linkname=Investing%20In%20Stocks%3A%20Discover%20The%203%20%27Big%20Rocks%27%20For%20How%20To%20Buy%20Stocks" title="Facebook" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/facebook.png" width="25" height="25" alt="Facebook"></a><a class="a2a_button_twitter" href="https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/twitter?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.investors.com%2Fhow-to-invest%2Finvesting-in-stocks-see-how-to-buy-stocks-investing-for-beginners%2F&linkname=Investing%20In%20Stocks%3A%20Discover%20The%203%20%27Big%20Rocks%27%20For%20How%20To%20Buy%20Stocks" title="Twitter" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/twitter.png" width="25" height="25" alt="Twitter"></a><a class="a2a_button_linkedin" href="https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/linkedin?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.investors.com%2Fhow-to-invest%2Finvesting-in-stocks-see-how-to-buy-stocks-investing-for-beginners%2F&linkname=Investing%20In%20Stocks%3A%20Discover%20The%203%20%27Big%20Rocks%27%20For%20How%20To%20Buy%20Stocks" title="LinkedIn" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/linkedin.png" width="25" height="25" alt="LinkedIn"></a><a class="a2a_dd addtoany_share_save addtoany_share" href="https://www.addtoany.com/share"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/email.png" alt="Share"></a></div> <a class="reprints-button sharing" href="https://www.ibdlicensing.com" target="_blank">Licensing</a>
</div>
<ul class="post-meta">
<li><span class="authors-links"><a href="https://www.investors.com/author/galganim/" title="Posts by MATTHEW GALGANI" class="author url fn" rel="author">MATTHEW GALGANI</a></span></li>
<li class="post-time">04:05 PM ET 05/19/2020</li>
</ul>
</div>
</header>
<div class="single-post-content post-content drop-cap">
<p>When it comes to investing in stocks, it can be hard to know where to start. But to stay both protected and profitable in the stock market, it helps to focus on what we call the "three big rocks" of <a href="https://www.investors.com/ibd-university/can-slim/">CAN SLIM investing</a>. Following this approach will help you zero in on the top stocks to watch at any given time, names like <strong>Apple</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=AAPL' target='_blank'>AAPL</a>), <strong>Amazon.com</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=AMZN' target='_blank'>AMZN</a>), <strong>Nvidia</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=NVDA' target='_blank'>NVDA</a>), and <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/ibd-long-term-leaders-screen/">IBD Long-Term Leader</a> <strong>Microsoft</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=MSFT' target='_blank'>MSFT</a>).</p>
<span>
<span style="width:50%;" class="video-player-container vms-left">
<span class="shortcode-video" vid-id="5594185" vid-dom-id="5594185-5ec4951344820" vid-top="false" vid-repeat="1" vid-width="50" vid-url="https://content.jwplatform.com/manifests/cs5MRUlx.m3u8" data-captions="" vid-name="3 Steps To Handle Stock Market Downturns" vid-cat="Learn How To Trade Stocks Using Research Tools" vid-date="03/11/2020" vid-image="https://www.investors.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/cs5MRUlx-640x360.jpg" vid-authors="Matt Galgani">
<span class="close-mini-vid">X</span>
<span id="shortcode-video-player-5594185-5ec4951344820" class="ready-to-load"></span>
</span>
</span>
</span><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":"3 Steps To Handle Stock Market Downturns","description":"A sharp stock market correction can rattle investor psychology. Here are 3 steps you can take to stay protected and get ready to profit in the next uptrend.","thumbnailUrl":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/03\/cs5MRUlx-640x360.jpg","contentUrl":"https:\/\/content.jwplatform.com\/manifests\/cs5MRUlx.m3u8","uploadDate":"2020-03-11T10:55:41+0000","duration":"PT100.59S","author":"Matt Galgani","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Investor's Business Daily","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ibd-logo.png"},"url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com"},"keywords":""}</script>
<p>As outlined in <a href="https://www.amazon.com/Make-Money-Stocks-Getting-Started/dp/0071810110" target="_blank" rel="noopener">"How To Make Money In Stocks — Getting Started,"</a> the idea is to "put the big rocks in first." That is, to focus first and foremost on the key factors that most affect individual stocks and the general market. By putting these "big rocks" in before you could get potentially sidetracked by other factors, you'll be positioning yourself for long-term success investing in stocks.</p>
<p>You'll also be laying the groundwork for avoiding common investing mistakes that can hinder your results.</p>
<p>Following these three core principles is particulary important when navigating major market moments like the <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/coronavirus-stock-market-crash-survival-guide/">coronavirus stock market crash</a> and eventual rebound.</p>
<hr />
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="https://www.investors.com/research/coronavirus-stock-market-crash-survival-guide/">Coronavirus Stock Market Surival Guide</a></p>
<hr />
<h2>Investing In Stocks: Big Rock No. 1</h2>
<p>One of the most important tenets of investing for beginners and seasoned investors alike is this: Only buy stocks in a market uptrend. Take defensive action in a weakening stock market.</p>
<p>You can identify the <a href="https://www.investors.com/videos/is-it-time-to-get-into-or-out-or-the-stock-market/">current market trend</a> by regularly checking Investor's Business Daily's Market Pulse, which shows which of three possible stages the stock market is currently in: Confirmed uptrend, Uptrend under pressure or Market in correction.</p>
<p>Over 100 years of stock market history show that three out of four stocks move in the same direction as the general market. You don't want to fight those odds! Instead, learn to stay in sync with the market and only make new buys when the odds are in your favor and the indexes are trending higher.</p>
<p>As Apple stock, Amazon stock, Microsoft stock, and virtually all leaders got hit in the current coronavirus sell-off, the importance of this one rule is clear. Stock market history shows how about three out of four stocks simply follow the overal trend of the major indexes. So it's not suprising to see most stocks get pulled down in the face of the coronavirus panic.</p>
<p>It's also not surprising that as the coronavirus stock market rally has taken hold, many of these leaders are now at or new new all-time highs.</p>
<hr />
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="https://www.investors.com/videos/how-to-profit-with-the-can-slim-investing-system/">Watch Free Webinar On How To Stay Profitable & Protected In Volatile Market</a></p>
<hr />
<h2>Investing In Stocks: Big Rock No. 2</h2>
<p>Here's the second "big rock" of CAN SLIM investing that you want to keep in place: Focus on stocks with big earnings and sales growth driven by new, innovative products and services.</p>
<p>Stocks like Apple, Microsoft, Nvidia, <strong>Zoom Video Communications</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=ZM' target='_blank'>ZM</a>), and countless others become big winners as they post exceptional earnings per share and revenue gains. And these gains typically come from companies that are flashing something "new" — a new product, new management, or a new industry trend. This can also apply to stocks that have recently launched a new initial public offering, or IPO.</p>
<p>So when you're looking for stocks to buy and watch, keep a close eye on stocks showing these <a href="https://www.investors.com/ibd-data-stories/companies-now-outperforming-95-of-all-stocks/">telltale CAN SLIM traits</a>.</p>
<h2>Investing In Stocks: Big Rock No. 3</h2>
<p>The final key factor for successfully investing in stocks is to buy stocks being heavily bought by large, institutional investors and avoid those they're selling aggressively.</p>
<p>It's mutual funds, pension funds, banks, and other large money managers that account for the bulk of all trading in the market — not individual investors. Since these professional portfolio managers have the power to significantly move a stock up or down, it's crucial that you pay attention to what they are buying and selling.</p>
<p>For example, from February to April of this year, seven leading stocks received more than $1 billion each in investments from the top funds. This elite group included Apple, <strong>Facebook</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=FB' target='_blank'>FB</a>), Microsoft, <strong>Netflix</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=NFLX' target='_blank'>NFLX</a>) and Google parent <strong>Alphabet</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=GOOGL' target='_blank'>GOOGL</a>).</p>
<p>You can see what the <a href="https://www.investors.com/best-mutual-funds-awards/">best mutual funds</a> are up to by <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/stock-chart-reading-for-beginners/">using stock charts</a> to track the price and volume action. With stock charts, you can get a truly objective look at the health of your stocks, without relying on rumors or hearsay.</p>
<h2>See How To Invest In Stocks With This 3-Step Routine</h2>
<p>Once you have a basic understanding of the three main factors that impact your stocks, put this approach into practice by making it a simple and streamlined three-step routine. By following these steps, you can quickly spot market trends, track stocks with the most important CAN SLIM traits, and see which stocks the best mutual funds are heavily buying (and selling).</p>
<p>The key is to follow the routine <em>regularly </em>so you stay in sync with the market, identify ideal buy points, and get a timely look at the <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/leaderboard/?artProdLink=Leaderboard">best stocks to buy and sell</a>. Market direction can change on a dime for better or worse, so it's crucial that you stay on top of any changes to the health of your stocks and the general market.</p>
